abstract.text: New measurements of the masses and decay branching fractions of charmonium and bottomonium states using the data collected by the CLEO detector are presented.
These include CLEO identification of the singlet states η ′ c (2S ), h c (1P), and η b (1S ).
Comparison with other experimental measurements and theoretical models is also presented.

body_text.text: INTRODUCTION
The QCD interaction can be studied in light quark (u, d, s) hadrons as well as heavy quark (c, b) hadrons.
body_text.section: INTRODUCTION

body_text.text: In contrast to light quarks, heavy quark states are narrow and do not mix with the states of other quarks.

body_text.text: Also, the effective coupling constant and relativistic problems are far more tractable.
body_text.section: INTRODUCTION

body_text.text: Thus, the spectra of charmonium and bottomonium are easier to characterize and study.

body_text.text: THE qq HYPERFINE INTERACTION
In the quark model the hyperfine spin-spin interaction determines the ground-state masses of the hadrons.
body_text.section: THE qq HYPERFINE INTERACTION

body_text.text: The mass of a pseudoscalar or vector qq meson is
body_text.section: THE qq HYPERFINE INTERACTION

body_text.text: The s 1 • s 2 spin-spin, or hyperfine interaction gives rise to the hyperfine, or spin-singlet/spin-triplet splitting in quarkonium spectrum,
body_text.section: THE qq HYPERFINE INTERACTION

body_text.text: The hyperfine interaction is not well understood because until recently there were not enough experimental data to provide the required constraints for the theory.
body_text.section: THE qq HYPERFINE INTERACTION

body_text.text: For thirty years after the discovery of J/ψ, the only hyperfine splitting measured in a hidden flavor meson was ∆M h f (1S) cc ≡ M(J/ψ) − M(η c ) = 116.4 ± 1.2 MeV [1].
body_text.section: THE qq HYPERFINE INTERACTION

body_text.text: No other singlet states, η ′ c (2 1 S 0 ) cc , h c (1 1 P 1 ) cc , or η b (1 1 S 0 ) bb were identified, and none of the important questions about the hyperfine interaction could be answered.
body_text.section: THE qq HYPERFINE INTERACTION

body_text.text: This has changed in the last few years.

body_text.text: η ′ c (2S ), Hyperfine Splitting in a Radial Excitation

In 2002, Belle claimed identification of η ′ c in the decay of 45 million B mesons, B → K(K S Kπ) and reported M(η ′ c ) = 3654 ± 10 MeV, which would correspond to ∆M h f (2S ) = 32 ± 10 MeV [2], a factor two smaller than expected and a factor four smaller than ∆M h f (1S ).
body_text.section: η ′ c (2S ), Hyperfine Splitting in a Radial Excitation

body_text.text: It became important to confirm this result.
body_text.section: η ′ c (2S ), Hyperfine Splitting in a Radial Excitation

body_text.text: There are two important ways 2S states differ from 1S states.
body_text.section: η ′ c (2S ), Hyperfine Splitting in a Radial Excitation

body_text.text: 1S states, with r ≈ 0.4 f, lie in the Coulombic region (∼ 1/r) of the qq potential, V = A/r + Br, whereas the 2S states, with r ≈ 0.8 f, lie in the confinement part (∼ r) of the potential (see Fig. 1, right).
body_text.section: η ′ c (2S ), Hyperfine Splitting in a Radial Excitation

body_text.text: The spin-spin potential in the two regions could be different.
body_text.section: η ′ c (2S ), Hyperfine Splitting in a Radial Excitation

body_text.text: The second difference is that the 2S states, particularly ψ(2S ), lie close to the DD breakup threshold at 3730 MeV, and can be expected to mix with the continuum as well as higher 1 −− states.
body_text.section: η ′ c (2S ), Hyperfine Splitting in a Radial Excitation

body_text.text: All in all, it is important to nail down η ′ c experimentally, and measure its mass accurately.
body_text.section: η ′ c (2S ), Hyperfine Splitting in a Radial Excitation

body_text.text: This was successfully done by CLEO [3] and BaBar [4] in 2004 by observing η ′ c in two-photon fusion, γγ → η ′ c → K S Kπ.
body_text.section: η ′ c (2S ), Hyperfine Splitting in a Radial Excitation

body_text.text: The two observations are shown in Fig. 2.
body_text.section: η ′ c (2S ), Hyperfine Splitting in a Radial Excitation

body_text.text: The average of all measurements is M(η ′ c ) = 3637 ± 4 MeV [1], which leads to ∆M h f (2S) = 49 ± 4 MeV, which is almost a factor 2.5 smaller than ∆M h f (1S ).
body_text.section: η ′ c (2S ), Hyperfine Splitting in a Radial Excitation

body_text.text: Explaining this large difference is a challenge to the theory.
body_text.section: η ′ c (2S ), Hyperfine Splitting in a Radial Excitation

body_text.text: The challenge for the experimentalists lies in completing the spectroscopy of η ′ c , now that its mass is known.
body_text.section: η ′ c (2S ), Hyperfine Splitting in a Radial Excitation

body_text.text: In particular, it is important to measure its width.

body_text.text: Hyperfine Splittings Measurements
To summarize, we now have well-measured experimental results for several hyperfine splittings, with significant contributions from CLEO measurements.
body_text.section: Hyperfine Splittings Measurements

body_text.text: In charmonium, we do not have satisfactory understanding of the variation of hyperfine splitting for the S-wave radial states, and for P-wave state.
body_text.section: Hyperfine Splittings Measurements

body_text.text: • For charmonium, we do not have any unquenched lattice predictions, at present.
body_text.section: Hyperfine Splittings Measurements

body_text.text: • For bottomonium, lattice predictions are available, and they appear to be on the right track.
body_text.section: Hyperfine Splittings Measurements

body_text.text: • For neither charmonium nor bottomonium there are any reliable predictions of transitions strength, particularly for forbidden M1 transitions.
body_text.section: Hyperfine Splittings Measurements

body_text.text: Much remains to be done.
body_text.section: Hyperfine Splittings Measurements

body_text.text: On the experimental front it is very important to identify for bottomonium the allowed M1 transition, Υ(1S ) → γη b (1S ), and to identify the bottomonium singlet P-state, h b ( 1 P 1 ).
body_text.section: Hyperfine Splittings Measurements

body_text.text: On the theoretical front one would like to see unquenched lattice calculations for charmonium singlets, and, of course, for transition strengths.

body_text.text: CLEO data at ψ(2S ) and Υ(1S , 2S , 3S ) resonances were analyzed.
The prominent results are the following.
• Observation of η ′ c (2S) in γγ fusion, and its mass measurement.
Search for η ′ c (2S ) in exclusive decays, and upper limit measurements for decay branching fractions.
• Observation of h c (1P) in ψ(2S ) → π 0 h c , and precision measurement of its mass.
Evidence of h c decay in multipion exclusive final state.
• Confirmation of η b (1S) observation, and measurement of mass of η b and decay branching fraction B(Υ(3S ) → γη b ).
